Description: Base and lid of a polychrome painted cartonnage mummy-case for the mummy of Taminis, daughter of Shepminis, anthropoid, face and hair gilded, wearing a short-sleeved tunic, the border being decorated with hunting scenes and vignettes of domestic activities, which reaches to the ankles, the mantle, knotted between the breasts, covers the right shoulder and the loose end is drawn over the left shoulder from behind, and sandals; the name, in black painted Demotic, appears on the left shoulder; other funerary deities are represented around the edges of the lid; colours now faded.
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 61 [30]. Mark Smith in Bierbrier (ed.) Portraits and Masks (1997) p.66-71 [pls.7.3, 32.1] Albersmeier, Unterschungen zu den Frauenstatuen, 271 n. 473. Riggs, Beautiful Burial in Roman Egypt (2005): 62, 63, 66, 67, 70, 71 Fig. 25, 80, 81, 262-3; 247 n. 6 S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1075.
Published in S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1075.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p21)
Riggs 2005 / Beautiful burial in Roman Egypt (no.15, fig.25)
Daniels et al 2014 / Technological insights into madder pigment production in antiquity (p.14, fig.1)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
